sources.text: 1789; Samuel Smith (Pa); 53; Returned 1791. Died 9 mo 1817aged 81 min 47 years
sources.citation: Philadelphia Yearly Meeting of Ministers & Elders,  List of visiting ministers, 1656-1831,  via Ancestry.com search, July 7 2021.

sources.text: p. 506-509. 1819. Testimony concerning Samuel Smith. This our dear Friend was born in Bucks County, Pennsylvania the 2nd of the 4th month 1737 old style; his parents Robert and Phebe Smith were worthy members of our religious society... Being of a delicate constitution and unable to engage in any laborious occupation he removed to this city and about the year 1763 married and settled... the first of the ninth month, he quietly departed this life in the eighty first year of his age...
sources.citation: Philadelphia Yearly Meeting of Ministers & Elders, Testimonies concerning deceased Friends, various yearly meetings, 1687-1864,  via Ancestry.com search, July 7 2021.

snacControlMetadata.note: Contributors from initial SNAC EAC-CPF ingest

biogHists.text:
Samuel was a Quaker from Philadelphia. He was born ca. 1738, the son of Robert Smith of Buckingham Monthly Meeting of Friends. In 1763 he married Mary Woolston, the daughter of John Woolston of Middletown. Samuel Smith was a travelling Quaker minister whose journeys took him to New England as well as London and Liverpool.

From the description of Papers, 1740-1817. (Swarthmore College). WorldCat record id: 31391869

resource.title: John Hunt papers, 1770-1828.
resource.abstract: John Hunt kept a diary for more than 40 years, recording Quaker concerns and daily events. This collections consists primarily of the manuscript journal, 1770-1800; fragments of 1805, 1806 & 1808; and 1814-1824. Of particular interest are the visits of prominent Quakers, including Elias Hicks and Jonathan Evans. There is also an account book, some correspondence received, and other miscellaneous materials. Correspondents include Ann R. Matlack, Asa Matlack, Elizabeth A. Lippincott, John Cox, Joseph Foulke, and Josiah Roberts.

nameEntries.original: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

resource.title: Samuel Smith papers
resource.abstract: This collection includes 10 memorandum books of Samuel Smith, recounting his experiences as a travelling Quaker minister on his journeys in the eastern United States, Liverpool, London and Scotland. Also included is the copy book of a certain "S.B." of Darby Monthly Meeting, dated 1740-1746. This book contains tables of climates and distances, home remedies, and personal financial records. Notable are a list of the holdings of the Philadelphia library in 1741, an elegy to John Chalkley (1741), and an elegy to Robert Jordan.

resource.title: Papers, 1740-1817.

Also included is the copy book of a certain "S.B." of Darby Monthly Meeting, dated 1740-1746. This book contains tables of climates and distances, home remedies, and personal financial records.
